content.description: Carolyn is favored to win a long-distance foot race in the state finals. Shortly before reaching the finish line of the race, the competitor in front of Carolyn trips on accident, causing Carolyn to fall and no longer be in contention to win the race. Carolyn is convinced the competitor who caused her fall is untrustworthy and will do anything to win.
content.question: Carolyn’s explanation for her competitor’s behavior is most consistent with which of the following concepts?

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
